articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.title: From war to diplomacy, Iran weighs response to Soleimani's killing
articles.description: Iran's leaders have promised to avenge the killing of General Qassem Soleimani, commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guards Quds Force, by the United States.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran’s leaders have promised to avenge the killing of General Qassem Soleimani, commander of Iran’s Revolutionary Guards Quds Force, by the United States.

articles.title: JetBlue to use alternative fuel source on flights out of San Francisco
articles.description: JetBlue Airways Corp on Monday said it would use an alternative fuel source for flights leaving from San Francisco and plans to curb carbon dioxide emissions from jet fuel for domestic flights as it aims to reduce its carbon footprint.
articles.content:
Jan 6 (Reuters) - JetBlue Airways Corp on Monday said it would use an alternative fuel source for flights leaving from San Francisco and plans to curb carbon dioxide emissions from jet fuel for domestic flights as it aims to reduce its carbon footprint.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: EU foreign ministers to meet on Iran on Friday: diplomats
articles.description: European Union foreign ministers will hold an emergency meeting on Friday in Brussels to discuss ways to try to save the Iran nuclear deal, two diplomats said.
articles.content:
BRUSSELS (Reuters) - European Union foreign ministers will hold an emergency meeting on Friday in Brussels to discuss ways to try to save the Iran nuclear deal, two diplomats said. 
Reporting by Robin Emmott; editing by Francesco Guarascio

articles.author: Stanley Widianto
articles.title: Indonesia mobilizes fishermen in stand-off with China
articles.description: Indonesia will mobilize fishermen to join warships in the South China Sea to help defend against Chinese vessels, the government said on Monday, as the biggest stand-off with China for years escalated off Southeast Asia's largest country.
articles.content: JAKARTA (Reuters) - Indonesia will mobilize fishermen to join warships in the South China Sea to help defend against Chinese vessels, the government said on Monday, as the biggest stand-off with China for years escalated off Southeast Asia’s largest country. … [+2256 chars]

articles.title: UPDATE 1-Occidental to cut Western Midstream majority stake below 50%
articles.description: Occidental Petroleum Corp said on Monday it would cut its majority stake in pipeline operator Western Midstream Partners LP to less than 50% in 2020, as it looks to reduce its debt that grew significantly with the Anadarko deal.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Weinstein rape trial begins in Manhattan court
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein arrived at a Manhattan court on Monday for the start of his landmark trial on charges of rape, allegations that helped fuel the #MeToo movement and a reckoning for powerful men accused of sexual misconduct. Jillian Kitchener has more.
articles.content:
Posted 
Harvey Weinstein arrived at a Manhattan court on Monday for the start of his landmark trial on charges of rape, allegations that helped fuel the #MeToo movement and a reckoning for powerful men accused of sexual misconduct. Jillian Kitchener has more.

articles.title: Mexico's Aeromexico reaches compensation agreement with Boeing on MAX crisis
articles.description: Mexican airline Aeromexico said on Monday it had reached a compensation agreement with Boeing Co in relation to the temporary grounding of the planemaker's 737 MAX aircraft.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Mexican airline Aeromexico (AEROMEX.MX) said on Monday it had reached a compensation agreement with Boeing Co (BA.N) in relation to the temporary grounding of the planemaker’s 737 MAX aircraft.

articles.title: U.N. resumes grain milling in starvation-threatened Yemen
articles.description: The U.N. World Food Programme has resumed the milling of grain for food aid to a starving population in Yemen after a halt in late December due to shelling damage, the agency said on Monday.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The U.N. World Food Programme has resumed the milling of grain for food aid to a starving population in Yemen after a halt in late December due to shelling damage, the agency said on Monday.

articles.title: First Solar to pay $350 million to end shareholder lawsuit, avert trial
articles.description: First Solar Inc said on Monday it agreed to pay $350 million to settle a long-running shareholder lawsuit accusing the solar panel maker of inflating its stock price by concealing design defects and reporting misleading financials over nearly four years.
